sen.j: 烏丸通（からすまどおり）は京都市の主要な南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Karasuma-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets in Kyoto City.
Karasuma-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.
Karasuma-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 本来は「からすまる」と読むが、撥音便化し、現在は「からすま」と読む方が多い。
sen.e: The kanji “烏丸通” is originally read as “Karasumaru,” but the pronunciation has been simplified and it has been read as “Karasuma.”
The kanji “烏丸通” is originally read as “Karasumaru,” but the pronunciation has been simplified and now reads “Karasuma.”
The kanji 烏丸 is originally read as 'Karasumaru,' but the pronunciation has been simplified and now reads 'Karasuma.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」にあわせ"を'に原文に『』のない" "を削除通を削除

sen.j: 平安京の烏丸小路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Karasumaru-Koji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Karasumaru-Koji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Karasumaru-Koji Street of Heiankyo.

sen.j: 北は北大路バスターミナル（北大路駅）の北側の今宮通まで。
sen.e: In the north it extends to the Imamiya-dori Street just north of Kitaoji Bus Terminal (Kitaoji Station).
In the north it extends to Imamiya-dori Street just north of Kitaoji Bus Terminal (Kitaoji Station).
In the north it extends to Imamiya-dori Street just north of Kitaoji Bus Terminal (Kitaoji Station).

sen.j: 南は京都駅で分断されるが、久世橋通まで延びている。
sen.e: Southward, it is divided by Kyoto Station but extends to the Kuzebashi-dori Street.
Southward, it is bisected by Kyoto Station but extends to Kuzebashi-dori Street.
Southward, it is bisected by Kyoto Station but extends to Kuzebashi-dori Street.

sen.j: 北大路通以北を除いて4車線の道路である。
sen.e: It is a four-lane street throughout except the section north of the Kitaoji-dori Street.
It is a four-lane street throughout, except for the section north of Kitaoji-dori Street.
It is a four-lane street throughout, except for the section north of Kitaoji-dori Street.

sen.j: 四条烏丸交差点周辺を中心として烏丸通は京都のビジネス街とされ、多くの銀行や会社がある。
sen.e: The area along the Karasuma Street in particular around the Shijo-Karasuma crossing is known as the business district of Kyoto, where many banks and companies are located.
The area along Karasuma Street, particularly around the Shijo-Karasuma crossing, is known as the business district of Kyoto, where many banks and companies are located.
The area along Karasuma Street, particularly around the Shijo-Karasuma crossing, is known as the business district of Kyoto, where many banks and companies are located.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線がその下を通っている。
sen.e: The Karasuma-Sen (Karasuma Line) of Kyoto City Subway runs below the street.
The Karasuma-Sen (Karasuma Line) of Kyoto City Subway runs below the street.
The Karasuma-Sen (Karasuma Line) of Kyoto City Subway runs below the street.

sen.j: 烏丸通は、1877年に京都駅が誕生してから駅正面の大通りとなった。
sen.e: The Karasuma-dori Street has become a main street facing Kyoto Station since the station opened in 1877.
Karasuma-dori Street has been a main street facing Kyoto Station since the station opened in 1877.
Karasuma-dori Street has been a main street facing Kyoto Station since the station opened in 1877.

sen.j: 天皇が京都駅から京都御所へ行くための通路として拡幅されたためである。
sen.e: The street was widened as a path along which the Emperor goes to Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace).
The street was widened from its origination as a path along which the Emperor would go to Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace).
The street was widened from its origination as a path along which the Emperor would go to Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace) from Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 京都御所の西端を通り、京都駅を南北に交差するため、平安京の朱雀大路であった千本通に代わって、現在の京都のメインストリートとなっている。
sen.e: It has taken the place of the Senbon-dori Street, the former Suzakuoji broad avenue of Heiankyo to become a main street of present-day Kyoto, because it passes the west side of Kyoto Gosho and crosses Kyoto Station north and south.

It has taken the place of Senbon-dori Street, the former Suzakuoji broad avenue of Heiankyo, to become a main street of present-day Kyoto, because it passes the west side of Kyoto Gosho and crosses Kyoto Station north and south.

It has taken the place of Senbon-dori Street, the former Suzakuoji broad avenue of Heiankyo, to become a main street of present-day Kyoto, because it passes the west side of Kyoto Gosho and crosses Kyoto Station north and south.

sen.j: またこの通は、烏丸七条通から烏丸五条通までが国道24号、烏丸五条から烏丸北大路通までが国道367号となっている。
sen.e: Also the section between the Karasuma-Shichijo-dori Street and the Karasuma-Gojo-dori Street belongs to the National highway Route No. 24, and the section between the Karasuma-Gojo-dori Street and the Karasuma-Kitaoji-dori Street belongs to the National Highway Route No. 367.

Also, the section between Karasuma-Shichijo-dori Street and Karasuma-Gojo-dori Street belongs to National Highway Route No. 24, and the section between Karasuma-Gojo-dori Street and Karasuma-Kitaoji-dori Street belongs to National Highway Route No. 367.

Also, the section between Karasuma-Shichijo-dori Street and Karasuma-Gojo-dori Street belongs to National Highway Route No. 24, and the section between Karasuma-Gojo-dori Street and Karasuma-Kitaoji-dori Street belongs to National Highway Route No. 367.

sen.j: 御池通から四条通までが路上喫煙等禁止区域である。
sen.e: The street between the Oike-dori Street and the Shijo-dori Street has been designated as a Public Nonsmoking Area.
The section between Oike-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street has been designated as a public non-smoking area.
The section between Oike-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street has been designated as a public non-smoking area.

sen.j: 交差する道路などの特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by the local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
Roads are operated by the local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
